<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/05/congress-pushes-bidens-stimulus-bill-forward?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Your Stimulus Package Order Has Been Confirmed
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Biden stimulus plan" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTc0L2JpZGVuX3N0aW11bHVzX3BsYW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If President Biden’s $1.9 trillion stimulus plan were an Amazon package, it’d be sitting in a Cranbury, New Jersey, warehouse getting ready to ship. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the House followed the Senate in <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2021/02/05/house-biden-stimulus-harris-tiebreaker/?itid=hp-top-table-main-24&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approving a budget plan</a> that will allow Democrats to advance Biden’s stimulus plan without Republican support. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she’s hoping to pass the bill in the next two weeks, and it could become law by mid-March. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What about a compromise? </strong>Biden had met with 10 Republicans who offered up a much smaller proposal, but the president wasn’t convinced and said he’d favor speed over back-and-forth. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“If I have to choose between getting help right now to Americans who are hurting so badly and getting bogged down in a lengthy negotiation or compromising on a bill that’s up to the crisis, that’s an easy choice,” Biden </span><span><a href="https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/biden-covid-19-relief-gop/story?id=75710168&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained</a></span><span> yesterday.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The context</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Biden’s gargantuan proposal would certainly qualify for the Mt. Rushmore of stimulus packages right next to the historic $2 trillion CARES Act that was signed last March. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Republicans think $1.9 trillion is too much...and so do some Democrats. The economist Larry Summers, President Obama’s former top economic advisor, warned that the package would <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-05/biden-s-go-big-push-on-stimulus-gets-help-from-weak-jobs-senate?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">overheat the economy</a> and prevent the administration from pursuing other projects down the road. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Biden hasn’t budged from his “doing too much is better than doing too little” approach. He cited yesterday’s January jobs report as evidence the economy is still in heaps of trouble.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The US added just </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/unemployment-employment-figures-coronavirus-pandemic-economy-eade4d9aa17f447e6e8cb8f37b3f9a5c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">49,000 jobs</a></span><span> in January, below expectations but much better than December’s numbers. The unemployment rate fell from 6.7% to 6.3%.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>if you start to notice a shortage of Red Bull and Bagel Bites in the DC metro area, it’s because staffers will start hammering out the exact language of the bill next week. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FIREARMS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/05/us-firearms-sales-surge-january?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Trending Up: Gun Sales
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Workers arrange AR-15 style rifles on a wall that are for sale at Davids..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTc1L3VzLWFybXMtd2VhcG9ucnkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>George Frey/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Americans purchased more than 2 million firearms last month, an 80% increase from a year earlier, according to a <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/02/03/gun-sales-january-background-checks/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WaPo analysis</a>. It’s the third-highest monthly total on record. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To understand why, let’s look at the differences between January 2020 and January 2021. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In January 2020...</strong></span><span>we went to concerts, restaurants, and bars.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In January 2021...</strong></span><span>a pandemic raged and people needed to find outdoor leisure activities, such as shooting sports. The CEO of Minnesota-based Vista Outdoor told Bloomberg the “</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-05/covid-unrest-drive-gun-accessory-sales-vista-outdoor-ceo-says?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">primary driver</a></span><span>” of higher gun sales is Covid-19. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In January 2020...</strong></span><span>Donald Trump was president.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">In January 2021...</strong></span><span>Joe Biden took charge, but only after a violent mob attacked the US Capitol Building on Jan. 6. Gun sales tend to rise when a Democrat is elected president (like in 2008 and 2012 with Obama), and they </span><span><em>definitely</em></span><span> tend to rise when people are scared for their safety and crave protection.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some interesting stats to-go: </strong>First-time buyers accounted for about 40% of all guns purchased in 2020, according to the National Shooting Sports Foundation. And 40% of total purchases were made by women. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/05/kia-making-apple-car-georgia-factory?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Siri, Drive Us to Georgia
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The iCar rumors are heating up again: Kia is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/kia-is-preparing-to-build-apple-cars-in-the-u-s-11612498065?mod=hp_lista_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reportedly</a> seeking partners to help build fully electric, fully autonomous Apple cars at its West Point, Georgia, factory. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Apple <a href="https://www.macrumors.com/roundup/apple-car/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">started</a> its secretive Project Titan in 2014 to create an Apple Car, but later sought out partnerships with companies that have, you know, made stuff that doesn’t just fit in a carry-on. Apple’s talked about a vehicular team-up with at least six automakers, according to Nikkei.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s in it for Apple?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1) A manufacturing partner in Hyundai-Kia that has the auto supply chain and engineering expertise Apple lacks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2) Morgan Stanley analyst Katie Huberty <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/03/apple-and-hyundai-kia-driving-towards-deal-on-apple-car.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explained</a> in a research note that smartphones are a $500 billion market while mobility is worth $10 trillion. “So Apple would only need a 2% share of this market to be the size of their iPhone business.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When these two brands go out for dinner, how will they split the bill? According to CNBC’s sources, the Kia x Apple collab will be an “Apple Car,” not a Kia Soul with Apple Maps. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>reports indicate that the first Apple Cars could go into production as soon as 2024. But no agreement has been reached just yet, and Bloomberg wrote last night that talks have <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-05/apple-talks-with-hyundai-kia-on-electric-car-paused-recently?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recently paused</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/05/vaccine-updates-around-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When Your Vaccine Appointment Is at 4 but You Have a Meeting at 3:45
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="waiting in line for vaccine " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTc3L3dhaXRpbmdfaW5fbGluZV9mb3JfdmFjY2luZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mario Tama/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here’s the latest from the wide world of jabs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Variant vanquisher:</strong> A new study concluded that the vaccine from AstraZeneca and Oxford University was <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/astrazeneca-vaccine-effective-against-u-k-covid-19-variant-in-study-11612530912?mod=hp_lead_pos6&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">effective</a> against the “UK variant” of the coronavirus, which is more contagious than the original strain. The EU and UK have <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/healthcare/537462-astrazeneca-approvals-abroad-fuel-debate-over-speeding-us-process?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">greenlighted</a> AstraZeneca’s vaccine, but the FDA won't consider approving it until a US clinical trial has been completed. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Vaccines appear to be working: </strong>In Israel, 80% of people 60 and over received at least one vaccine dose by January 15. Now, Covid cases among that population are <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/0cdc8563-1e6d-4089-bedb-b0f675c0d683?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rapidly declining</a>, down 46% compared to their mid-January peak.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">You may get to an NFL stadium this year, after all: </strong>The league has <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2021/02/05/964548535/nfl-offers-all-30-stadiums-for-use-as-coronavirus-vaccine-sites?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offered up</a> all 30 of its venues as mass vaccination sites.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture numbers: </strong>More than 124 million doses have been <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/covid-vaccine-tracker-global-distribution/?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">administered</a> globally, per Bloomberg. The US has given 38.5 million doses.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMBLING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/02/05/super-bowl-2021-betting-big-game-set-drop-37-year?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Super Bowl LV: More Gambling Opportunities, Less Gambling
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="TAMPA, FLORIDA - JANUARY 31:  An aerial view of Raymond James Stadium ah..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTc2L3N1cGVyX2Jvd2xfbHZfLV9wcmV2aWV3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mike Ehrmann/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Will Tom Brady throw for 301.5 yards? How long will the national anthem last? Will Tony Romo mention GameStop? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If these questions get your heart thumping, you could be one of <a href="https://www.espn.com/chalk/story/_/id/30819949/survey-super-bowl-betting-expected-decrease-37-due-pandemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">23.2 million Americans</a> who are expected to spend $4.3 billion betting on the Super Bowl tomorrow. Sounds like a <em>ton</em>, but in fact it’s a 37% decrease from last year, according to the American Gaming Association.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s surprising...and it’s not. 36 million more Americans have access to legal sportsbooks this year thanks to relaxed regulations on the sector. But Covid-19 will likely dampen the action, especially at physical venues. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Despite a down year for Super Bowl bets, investors are <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-05/record-super-bowl-wagers-fire-up-rally-in-sports-gambling-stocks?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bullish</a> on the future of sports gambling. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>DraftKings stock has jumped 30% over the past month. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Penn National Gaming, owner of Barstool Sports, gained 9% yesterday to hit an all-time high. It’s up 45% in the last month. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Play along:</strong> We created a game based on fun “prop bets” for you to play virtually (or in-person) with friends during the Super Bowl tomorrow. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/superbowl-2021/stories/2021/02/02/super-bowl-prop-bets?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check it out</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">V helpful: </strong>A <a href="https://thehellyeahgroup.com/find-resources-tools-books-etc-1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">curated list</a> of financial tools and resources for creatives.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Weekend conversation starters:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Should you work with your friends and family? Morning Brew CEO Alex Lieberman </span><span><a href="https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/should-i-hire-my-friend/id1509276485?i=1000507554674" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">says no</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What could you talk about for </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/LauraSavino747/status/1356793595550924805?s=20" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">30 minutes</a></span><span> right now, without prepping at all? </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nECONOMY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nYour Stimulus Package Order Has Been Confirmed\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Biden stimulus plan\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zOTc0L2JpZGVuX3N0aW11bHVzX3BsYW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf President Biden’s $1.9 trillion stimulus plan were an Amazon package, it’d be sitting in a Cranbury, New Jersey, warehouse getting ready to ship. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the House followed the Senate in \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/us-policy/2021/02/05/house-biden-stimulus-harris-tiebreaker/?itid=hp-top-table-main-24\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproving a budget plan\u003c/a\u003e that will allow Democrats to advance Biden’s stimulus plan without Republican support. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she’s hoping to pass the bill in the next two weeks, and it could become law by mid-March. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat about a compromise? \u003c/strong\u003eBiden had met with 10 Republicans who offered up a much smaller proposal, but the president wasn’t convinced and said he’d favor speed over back-and-forth. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“If I have to choose between getting help right now to Americans who are hurting so badly and getting bogged down in a lengthy negotiation or compromising on a bill that’s up to the crisis, that’s an easy choice,” Biden \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/biden-covid-19-relief-gop/story?id=75710168\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplained\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e yesterday.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe context\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBiden’s gargantuan proposal would certainly qualify for the Mt. Rushmore of stimulus packages right next to the historic $2 trillion CARES Act that was signed last March. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRepublicans think $1.9 trillion is too much...and so do some Democrats. The economist Larry Summers, President Obama’s former top economic advisor, warned that the package would \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-05/biden-s-go-big-push-on-stimulus-gets-help-from-weak-jobs-senate?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoverheat the economy\u003c/a\u003e and prevent the administration from pursuing other projects down the road. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Biden hasn’t budged from his “doing too much is better than doing too little” approach. He cited yesterday’s January jobs report as evidence the economy is still in heaps of trouble.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe US added just \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/unemployment-employment-figures-coronavirus-pandemic-economy-eade4d9aa17f447e6e8cb8f37b3f9a5c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e49,000 jobs\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in January, below expectations but much better than December’s numbers. The unemployment rate fell from 6.7% to 6.3%.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eif you start to notice a shortage of Red Bull and Bagel Bites in the DC metro area, it’s because staffers will start hammering out the exact language of the bill next week. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmericans purchased more than 2 million firearms last month, an 80% increase from a year earlier, according to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/02/03/gun-sales-january-background-checks/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWaPo analysis\u003c/a\u003e. It’s the third-highest monthly total on record. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo understand why, let’s look at the differences between January 2020 and January 2021. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn January 2020...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ewe went to concerts, restaurants, and bars.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn January 2021...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ea pandemic raged and people needed to find outdoor leisure activities, such as shooting sports. The CEO of Minnesota-based Vista Outdoor told Bloomberg the “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-02-05/covid-unrest-drive-gun-accessory-sales-vista-outdoor-ceo-says?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprimary driver\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” of higher gun sales is Covid-19. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn January 2020...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDonald Trump was president.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn January 2021...\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eJoe Biden took charge, but only after a violent mob attacked the US Capitol Building on Jan. 6. Gun sales tend to rise when a Democrat is elected president (like in 2008 and 2012 with Obama), and they \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003edefinitely\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e tend to rise when people are scared for their safety and crave protection.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome interesting stats to-go: \u003c/strong\u003eFirst-time buyers accounted for about 40% of all guns purchased in 2020, according to the National Shooting Sports Foundation. And 40% of total purchases were made by women. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe iCar rumors are heating up again: Kia is \u003ca made stuff that doesn’t just fit in a carry-on. Apple’s talked about a vehicular team-up with at least six automakers, according to Nikkei.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s in it for Apple?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e1) A manufacturing partner in Hyundai-Kia that has the auto supply chain and engineering expertise Apple lacks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2) Morgan Stanley analyst Katie Huberty \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/02/03/apple-and-hyundai-kia-driving-towards-deal-on-apple-car.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplained\u003c/a\u003e in a research note that smartphones are a $500 billion market while mobility is worth $10 trillion. “So Apple would only need a 2% share of this market to be the size of their iPhone business.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen these two brands go out for dinner, how will they split the bill? According to CNBC’s sources, the Kia x Apple collab will be an “Apple Car,” not a Kia Soul with Apple Maps. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ereports indicate that the first Apple Cars could go into production as soon as 2024.
